ai-pli-tv-kd12:7.1.1_0: Soon afterwards Venerable Upāli approached the Buddha, bowed, sat down,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:7.1.2_0: and told him what had happened,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:7.1.3_0: “How many things are there, Venerable Sir, that stop a monk undertaking the trial period from counting a particular day toward his trial period?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:7.1.5_0: he stays in the same room as a regular monk; he stays apart from other monks; he doesn’t inform other monks of his status; he travels without a group.”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:7.1.6_0: These are the four such things that stop a monk undertaking the trial period.”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.1_0: At that time a large Saṅgha of monks had gathered there.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.2_0: The monks undertaking the trial period were not able to fulfill their duties.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.3_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.4_0: “I allow you to set aside the trial period.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.7_0: ‘I take hold of the trial period,’
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.8_0: And the trial period of six days had been given up.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.0_0: The proper conduct of those deserving rehabilitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.1_0: At this time monks deserving rehabilitation consented to regular monks bowing down to them, standing up for them, raising their joined palms to them, doing acts of respect for them, offering them a seat, offering them a bed, offering them water for washing their feet and a foot-stool, offering them a foot-scraper, receiving their bowl and robe,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.2_0: and massaging their backs when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.4_0: “How can monks deserving rehabilitation consent to these things?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.6_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that monks deserving rehabilitation consent to these things?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.10_0: “It’s not suitable, monks, it’s not proper for you to stay.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.11_0: How can monks deserving rehabilitation consent to these things?
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.11_1: and massaging their backs when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.14_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.15_0: “A monk deserving rehabilitation should not consent to:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.16_0: Regular monks bowing down to him;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.18_0: and massaging their backs when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.19_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.20_0: Monks deserving rehabilitation should bow down to one another according to seniority, and likewise stand up, raise their joined palms, do acts of respect, offer a seat, offer a bed, offer water for washing the feet and a foot-stool, offer a foot-scraper, receive bowl and robe, and massage one another’s backs according to seniority when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.20_1: and massaging their backs when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.21_0: Monks deserving rehabilitation should do five things with regular monks according to seniority:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.22_0: the observance-day procedure, the invitation procedure, the sharing out of rainy-season robes, meal invitations, and meals.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.23_0: And I will lay down the proper conduct for a monk deserving rehabilitation.
